revised_title: Investigations on the Evolution of Melanism in Lepidoptera: A Discussion on Natural Population Dynamics
tldr: This article discusses the evolution of melanism in Lepidoptera, specifically focusing on the Peppered Moth. The author investigates the factors influencing the survival of different color forms in response to environmental changes, such as industrial pollution. The study demonstrates that natural selection plays a significant role in the dynamics of natural populations, with melanistic forms being favored in polluted areas due to their increased cryptic advantages.
